name: 3-Nitrostilbene
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3833
Reason: 3-Nitrostilbene has a melting point that we can predict by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The nitro group introduces a strong dipole moment, increasing intermolecular interactions and melting point by approximately +20 °C. The stilbene ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 °C. The methoxy group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5 °C.
